intro: Centaurea paphlagonica, commonly known as the Paphlagonian knapweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry habitats, showcasing its adaptability to arid environments. Its flowers are usually pink to purple, with a central disc surrounded by ray florets. Centaurea paphlagonica is often found in meadows, grasslands, and along mountain slopes.
